intro: Hypochaeris arachnites, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal leaves that are hairy and often lobed. Its yellow flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, and the plant produces numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Hypochaeris arachnites is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common weed in agricultural and garden settings.
